item.description: In 2021, the University of California Santa Cruz (UCSC) was awarded funding from the Alfred P.

item.title: Johns Hopkins University OSPO
item.description: The Johns Hopkins University (JHU) Sheridan Libraries launched the JHU OSPO in 2019 as the first academic OSPO in the U.

item.title: Trinity College Dublin OSPO
item.description: Trinity College Dublin’s (TCD) OSPO was launched in 2020. The office is a division of Trinity Innovation within the university.

item.title: Open@RIT
item.description: Rochester Institute of Technology’s (RIT) Open@RIT office was launched in 2020 but their programs in Open Work date back to 2009 with its first course offering in Humanitarian Free and Open Source Software.

item.title: Empowering communities worlds apart
item.description: Executive summary Successful collaboration among three organizations—a community center, a university’s open source program office, and a government IT department—to deploy Lutèce, a modular open source platform designed for public support.

item.title: University Open Source Program Offices
item.description: The Sheridan Libraries at Johns Hopkins University (JHU) have launched the first US university-based open source programs office (OSPO).
